data: Easter was now fast approaching, and Fitzhenry announced to Emmeline his intention of going out of town for a fortnight,—but not to Arlingford—And he concluded by saying, that, of course, he supposed she would like to pass the time with her father at Charlton.
A Marriage in High Life, Volume II
Scott, Lady (Caroline Lucy), 1784-1857; Bury, Charlotte Campbell, Lady, 1775-1861 [Editor]
